name: Institute for Understanding Anti-Palestinian Racism
theoryOfChange: The Institute for the Understanding of Anti-Palestinian Racism (IUAPR) bases its work on the 'Anti-Palestinian Racism: Naming, Framing and Manifestations' report by the Arab Canadian Lawyers Association (ACLA). This report serves as a framework that provides a description of anti-Palestinian racism, explains how it operates to silence discourse on Palestine, and outlines its impacts on individuals and the broader community. It is used as a working description and framework for institutions, organizations, companies, and individuals to address incidents of anti-Palestinian racism. The framework details various forms of anti-Palestinian racism, including denying the Nakba, justifying violence against Palestinians, failing to acknowledge Palestinians as an Indigenous people, erasing their human rights, excluding Palestinian perspectives, and defaming Palestinians and their allies.

evaluationSources: UNCORROBORATED: UCSF Institutional Review Board (IRB) approval for research

zakatClaimEvidence: The official website and donation pages of the Institute for the Understanding of Anti-Palestinian Racism (IUAPR) do not explicitly mention 'zakat' or 'zakat donations', nor do they indicate dedicated zakat funds or campaigns. The organization is a U.S. 501(c)(3) tax-exempt non-profit organization focused on research, education, and advocacy to end anti-Palestinian racism. (Source: https://antipalestinianracism.org/donate)

dimension_explanations.alignment: The alignment score of 16/50 reflects a medium level of cause urgency within the advocacy space, though the donor fit for the broader Muslim community is currently rated as low [3]. The organization accepts general charitable contributions but does not provide specific frameworks for targeted giving [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The impact score of 18/50 is characterized by a focus on capacity building through education and training programs [3]. However, the effectiveness of these programs is difficult to measure due to a lack of cost-per-beneficiary data and limited financial reporting in recent filings [1].

baseline_narrative.summary: Based in the United States, the organization operates through three primary pillars: research, education and training, and advocacy and reporting [3]. The institute provides a platform for donors to contribute through general sadaqah to support its mission of addressing racial and systemic prejudice [2].

strengths.detail: The organization provides unique, <cite id="2">specialized research and education</cite> regarding the systemic nature of anti-Palestinian racism.
The institute maintains a <cite id="1">clear framework for its reporting and advocacy programs</cite>, focusing on long-term systemic shifts.

strengths_deep_dive: The organization's primary strength lies in its intellectual leadership within a niche advocacy space. By focusing on <cite id="1">research and education</cite>, it creates the foundational language and data necessary for broader advocacy efforts. Its impact is evidenced by its ability to influence academic discourse, specifically regarding <cite id="3">faculty associations and their adoption of specific racial frameworks</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Institute for the Understanding of Anti-Palestinian Racism Inc is a specialized nonprofit organization that addresses systemic prejudice through a multi-faceted approach. Based in the United States, the organization focuses on <cite id="1">research, education and training, and advocacy and reporting</cite> to challenge anti-Palestinian bias. Its work is centered on providing a <cite id="2">framework for naming and framing</cite> the specific manifestations of this form of racism. One of the organization's documented outcomes includes tracking <cite id="3">40 faculty associations that have rejected the IHRA definition</cite> of antisemitism in favor of frameworks that protect Palestinian advocacy. The institute operates as a <cite id="4">capacity-building entity</cite>, providing resources and intellectual infrastructure for activists and educators. While the organization serves a niche and urgent cause area, it currently maintains <cite id="5">limited public financial data</cite>, which impacts its overall transparency profile. Donors can support the mission through <cite id="6">general sadaqah contributions</cite> via their digital donation platform.
